intro: Otiophora multicaulis, commonly known as the clustered mossy bell, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered inflorescences that resemble miniature umbels. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that contribute to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Its botanical structure supports its role as a valuable component of forest ecosystems.
